title: Spotify's music hardware could be right around the corner | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Spotify’s in-house music hardware could arrive a lot sooner than expected.
At least, that’s what a number of new job listings would lead you to
believe.**

It’s been [revealed](https://www.theverge.com/2018/2/20/17031396/spotify-job-
listing-hardware-music-streaming) that music streaming giant Spotify has
started advertising three vacant positions in its hardware division, leading
some to believe that the firm’s long-rumoured music equipment could arrive as
soon as the end of 2018.

That’s nothing but speculation, though – as is what exactly it’s working on.
Information included in a job listing from 2017 said it wanted to create a
“category-defining product akin to Pebble Watch, Amazon Echo, and Snap
Spectacles”.

**Related:[MWC 2018](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/mwc-2018-news-
rumours-dates-preview-barcelona-3372243)**

Rumour-spinners took that tidbit and turned it into reports claiming that
Spotify’s working on either a high-end smart speaker to rival the [Amazon
Echo](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/amazon-echo) or a wearable of
some description – both of which fall well within the realm of possibility.

![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Image: Spotify**

We haven’t caught wind of any information that would suggest it’s working on
any of the aforementioned hardware, however. All we know – as per the latest
[job listings](https://www.spotifyjobs.com/job/senior-project-manager-
hardware-production-omqv6fwx/) – is that the firm’s “on its way to creating
its first physical product.”
